content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Toa Payoh Group Representation Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Toa Payoh Group Representation Constituency** was a [group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) in [central](/wiki/Central_Region,_Singapore) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## History [Kim Keat Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Kim_Keat_Single_Member_Constituency) was absorbed in the 1991 elections. In 1997, the ward was merged along with [Thomson GRC](/wiki/Thomson_Group_Representation_Constituency) to form [Bishan–Toa Payoh GRC](/wiki/Bishan%E2%80%93Toa_Payoh_Group_Representation_Constituency). Ong would resign in 1993 to contest in the [Presidential Election](/wiki/1993_Singaporean_presidential_election) and later become the 5th [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). After S. Dhanabalan retired from his cabinet position in 1994, it was one of the group representation constituencies without an anchor minister. ## Members of Parliament YearDivisionMembers of ParliamentParty**Formation**(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) - Kuo Chuan - Boon Teck - Toa Payoh - [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) - Ho Tat Kin - [Davinder Singh](/wiki/Davinder_Singh_(lawyer)) [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election) - Kuo Chuan - Boon Teck - Toa Payoh - Kim Keat - [S. Dhanabalan](/wiki/S._Dhanabalan) - Ho Tat Kin - [Davinder Singh](/wiki/Davinder_Singh_(lawyer)) - [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) (1991–1993)[a] **Constituency abolished (1997)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s [General Election 1988](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) Ho Tat Kin [Davinder Singh](/wiki/Davinder_Singh_(lawyer))*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)49,243[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) ### Elections in 1990s [General Election 1991](/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[S. Dhanabalan](/wiki/S._Dhanabalan) Ho Tat Kin [Davinder Singh](/wiki/Davinder_Singh_(lawyer)) [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong)*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)63,59129.14[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold** ## Notes This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Toa Payoh Group Representation Constituency
